alert.note: Alert for Koochiching; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 2:17PM CDT until June 27 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, in north central Minnesota, Koochiching. In northeast Minnesota, St. Louis. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lakes, rivers, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are flooded and some sand bagging operations are continuing. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 152 PM CDT, Monday, Emergency Management reported ongoing extensive flooding. - Namakan and Kabetogama Lakes were at 1120.0 feet as of June 27, which is below the peak level reached in 2014. The level of Namakan Lake is expected to fall by 12 to 15 inches between June 27 and July 3. Namakan Lake level has fallen 33 inches since the crest on May 1. Rainy Lake level is 1112.6 feet as of June 27, which is 15 inches above the 2014 peak and very close to the (now previous) record set in 1950. The level of Rainy Lake is expected to fall by 7 to 9 inches between June 27 and July 3. Rainy Lake Lake levels have fallen 9 inches since the crest on June 15th. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... International Falls, Kabetogama, Crane Lake, Kabetogama Lake, Voyageurs National Park, Rainy Lake East, Rainy Lake West, northwestern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Ranier, Ray, Island View, Ericksburg, Johnson Lake and Sand Point Lake. - For more information about flood safety visit, https://weather.gov/safety/flood . For more information about the Rainy Lake Basin flooding visit, https://weather.gov/dlh/RainyRiverBasin .
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Lake levels have peaked, it will take a matter of weeks to a month for levels to decline to near normal summer levels. Additional rainfall will prolong the time it takes for levels to recede.
